fields.headline: News in brief
fields.bodyText: Park and ride at London airports Visitors to London can avoid traffic jams by taking advantage of cheaper airport parking and train tickets until the end of January. Anyone leaving their car at Gatwick, Heathrow or Stansted airports after 5pm on weekdays and all day at weekends will pay £5 per adult for a return train trip on showing the parking ticket and a flat fee of £5 at the car park when they returnwith the rail ticket. Danube cruise KD River Cruises (01372 744455) has introduced a Danube river cruise for next summer. The river has been closed since 1999 when bridges in the Yugoslav section were bombed by Nato. The 11-day cruise takes in the scenic Wachau valley, Vienna and Budapest before finishing on the Black Sea. Prices start from £1,695 including flights. Stay prepared The English Tourism Council has launched the 2002 editions of its Where to Stay guides.The guides are: Bed and Breakfast Guest Accommodation (£11.99), Self-Catering Holiday Homes (£9.99), Hotels (£10.99), Somewhere Special (£7.99) and Camping and Caravan Parks in Britain (£5.99). They are available from bookshops or from the ETC. Telephone: 0870 606 7204.
